intro: Otiophora lebruniana, commonly known as the Lebrun's rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, allowing it to store water efficiently.
